tweet:
This is a disgrace. A year ago we lost five people in the Capital Gazette shooting in Annapolis. 

Today should be about commemorating the lives we've lost and fighting for a future with no gun violence. We must do better. https://twitter.com/JenniferJJacobs/status/1144523828921372672 …
50 years ago, brave members of the LGBTQ+ community fought back against repression & police violence at the Stonewall Inn. I'm proud to honor them today. #Stonewall50
We need a national solution to gerrymandering. My letter to @senatemajldr: pic.twitter.com/BFvMfXTVxR
My statement on the gerrymandering decision: pic.twitter.com/3cb96LWY3n

.@RepSusanWild thank you for sharing your story. Your voice and leadership are inspiring to me and to so many others who can relate to your experience. I treasure our friendship. https://twitter.com/RepSusanWild/status/1143892124703842304 …

There are many other champions fighting alongside us. 

@RepAnnieKuster, @RepHalRogers, @SusanWBrooks, @RepBuddyCarter, and @LacyClayMO1  have been relentless in the fight against heroin and prescription drug abuse. #EndTheAddictionCrisis

We need to treat addiction like the crisis that it is.

Thank you @RepDanCrenshaw, @RepSusanWild, @RepMaxRose, @RepChrisPappas, @RepWexton, @RepRiggleman, @RepArmstrongND & @RepSherrill for taking action on this issue with me in the Freshmen Working Group on Addiction. pic.twitter.com/Z4EUrXtpDO

Today I wrote about how Congress is addressing the opioid epidemic.

With life expectancy declining three straight years for the first time in 100 years because of the opioid epidemic, Congress can't wait any longer to take action. https://thehill.com/blogs/congress-blog/healthcare/450098-congress-needs-to-continue-fighting-the-opioid-epidemic …

Today marks one year since the #SCOTUS decision to uphold Trump's #MuslimBan.

I'm proud to support two bills to defund & repeal the ban. Check out the new report from @NILC:  https://www.nilc.org/wp-content/uploads/2019/06/Impacts-of-the-Muslim-Ban-2019.pdf …

Thank you to @RepSusanWild, @RepJohnJoyce, @RepShalala, and @RepBrianFitz for co-sponsoring the Higher Education Mental Health Act of 2019. 

Together we can make sure our students have the mental health care they need to be successful.

Today I was proud to introduce the bipartisan Higher Education Mental Health Act of 2019. 

#Mentalhealth is a growing concern for students across the country, and we need to make sure our students have top notch mental health care. 

Thanks to @SenBobCasey for your partnership. pic.twitter.com/8KKatseIgi

Six years ago, the Supreme Court struck down a crucial portion of the #VotingRightsAct. Since then we've seen voter purges, reduced early voting periods, and nearly 1,000 polling places shuttered. We must ensure EVERY American is guaranteed equal access to vote. pic.twitter.com/qWulO2C7Wd

I was honored to receive the @uscoastguard seal to display in my office today. The men and women of the United States Coast Guard represent the best and brightest we have to offer as a country. I thank all of them for their service and sacrifice for our country. pic.twitter.com/YrScidzwe9
It was great running into my dear friend, former Montgomery County Executive Ike Leggett, while at @UatShadyGrove today. pic.twitter.com/y6eZ3YuBBt

Behavioral Health and Addiction Treatment is critical to battling the opioid crisis. Team Trone was proud to attend the Grand Opening of the @WesternMDHealth Behavioral Health Emergency Department yesterday, where patients will be able to get the specified care they need. https://twitter.com/CumberlandTN/status/1142430807346352128 …
ICE raids are starting Sunday to target families, including some in Baltimore. Immigrants have rights. Make sure you know yours: https://twitter.com/ACLU/status/1140991461938401280 …

It’s time that @SenateMjrLdr listen to the American people and give them the progress that they deserve. This means transitioning to clean, renewable energy, investing in environmental cleanup, and joining the international fight against climate change. #ForThePeople
Expanding broadband service to rural communities will be critical for strengthening the economy. I support @AppropsDems Agriculture bill, providing $680 million for broadband expansion.

Thank you to our working group members who came out today. By working together we can save lives and #EndTheAddictionCrisis
@RepArmstrongND @RepKimSchrier @RepLoriTrahan @RepJahanaHayes @RepDean @RepJohnJoyce @RepJasonCrow @RepTimBurchett @RepVanTaylor

Rhode Island saw a 61% decline in post-incarceration opioid deaths when they used Medication Assisted Treatment (MAT) in prisons. 

In the Freshmen Working Group on Addiction, we’re hearing from two Brown professors about how we can replicate these unbelievable numbers. pic.twitter.com/hwbW7tDBFS
Funding rural development programs will help EVERYONE participate in our economy. I’m proud to support @AppropsDems Agriculture bill, providing $3.9 billion in rural development and infrastructure.

Our servicemen and women put their lives on the line to defend our freedom. Now, it’s time that we take care of them. I’m proud to support the Defense @AppropsDems bill, which includes a 3.1% pay raise for those who serve in the military. #ForThePeople

The Paris Climate Agreement is fundamental to the future of our environment, and we cannot abandon this responsibility. @AppropsDems FY 2020 State and Foreign Ops bill will ensure that NO funds can be used to withdraw from the Paris Climate Agreement. #ForThePeople

.@RepSherrill and @RepRiggleman have been amazing partners and leaders in the fight to end the addiction epidemic. This $1.5 billion historic federal investment shows that Congress is serious about tackling the opioid crisis across the country. #EndTheAddictionCrisis https://twitter.com/RepSherrill/status/1141806669313335302 …
For the first time ever, $50 million will be allotted to the NIH and the CDC to study gun deaths in America. @HouseDemocrats are ready to end the gun violence epidemic once and for all. #ForThePeople

Thank you @RepRiggleman for being such a strong partner in the bipartisan Freshmen Working Group on Addiction and for working with me to put an end to the terrible opioid crisis in our country. Together we will make a difference in people's lives.

I was proud to work with @RepRiggleman on two amendments that would put additional funding toward expanding rural broadband deployment and combating the opioid crisis in rural communities. pic.twitter.com/QmlFiww3ao

I grew up on a farm that went bankrupt. It was because of a good education that I was given a shot in life.

Dual enrollment is a great program that means higher graduation rates and college attendance, but we must make sure it's available to ALL students equally. @EdLaborCmte pic.twitter.com/0AHWceDqwA

I’m proud to support Labor & HHS @AppropsDems bill, which includes:
✅$2.4 billion for Alzheimer’s research
✅$3.2 billion for HIV/AIDs research
✅$195 million for Cancer Moonshot research initiative
@HouseDemocrats are working #ForThePeople to promote a safe and healthy society.

The Trump Administration's threat to furlough OPM employees is baseless and wrong. Innocent federal workers do not deserve to be punished because the Administration isn't getting it's way. https://thehill.com/homenews/administration/449337-trump-officials-threaten-to-furlough-150-workers-at-federal-personnel …

To this day the Trump Administration has refused to deliver a report on the murder of Jamal #Khashoggi. The UN report's findings make it clear: no one is above the law and we need answers now. https://www.nytimes.com/2019/06/19/world/middleeast/jamal-khashoggi-Mohammed-bin-Salman.html …

Unbelievable. We need the full force of the federal government to work towards ending the climate crisis. This action takes us backward, and our children will pay the price. https://twitter.com/SpeakerPelosi/status/1141374704370012161 …

We have an unjust criminal justice system that transformed the idea of slavery into segregation & then mass incarceration. It perpetuates a vicious cycle that negatively affects people of color. Congress must act to pass REAL criminal justice reform. We have a lot of work to do.

On #Juneteenth we celebrate the liberation of enslaved people across the U.S. While we acknowledge this historic victory, we must recognize the injustices of the past and how far we still have to go to right these wrongs.

When Vincent Chin was brutally murdered 37 years ago his death became a rallying point for the #AAPI community. Now more than ever we must continue to come together against xenophobia and hate. https://www.nbcnews.com/news/asian-america/who-vincent-chin-history-relevance-1982-killing-n771291 …

Disgusting and immoral. The administration's destructive family separation policy is simply inexcusable, and families are being torn apart. We cannot sit idle as these horrors take place. https://twitter.com/maggieNYT/status/1140605424183521280 …

On this day in 1983 Sally Ride became an inspiration to many young women and men for being the first American woman to fly into space. Now, her fearlessness and determination continue to model what is possible for all those involved in STEM. https://www.nasa.gov/multimedia/imagegallery/image_feature_2533.html …

This is now the longest period in U.S. history without an increase to the federal minimum wage. I am proud to support the #RaisetheWage Act, which will give nearly 40 million Americans and over 64,000 people in Maryland's 6th District a raise. pic.twitter.com/Bk1B1dBECS

Team Trone was happy to attend the Third Annual Rockville Pride this weekend. I’m grateful to represent such an open and accepting city and I look forward to continuing the fight in Congress for equal rights for all! #PrideMonth pic.twitter.com/cUFzx6sGuB

Four years ago we lost nine lives to a horrendous act of gun violence. The Senate must follow the lead of the House and take action against gun violence now. https://twitter.com/WhipClyburn/status/1140606767249985537 …

Proud to have voted in favor of these proposals to improve health care for American families. It’s time for the @SenateGOP to finally listen to the people – not the donor class – and pass these measures to improve health care for all Americans! #HealthCareWeekend pic.twitter.com/2cFD18L94q

The path to stability in #Sudan passes through a civilian-led government - not the military. The people have spoken and deserve a democracy. TMC should listen to protesters and give the people of Sudan the government they've worked for years to achieve. Proud to #StandWithSudan
.@JohnsHopkins is doing some truly incredible research that will make our future a better place. Thanks for having me! https://twitter.com/JohnsHopkins/status/1139233773013180417 …

Diverse communities enrich our society and make America stronger. Immigrants have contributed to the extraordinary character of our nation and often made great sacrifices to be here. We must continue to push for immigration reform. #CelebrateImmigrants #ImmigrantHeritageMonth

Yesterday we saw a truly historic win by the U.S. Women’s Soccer Team. Shout out to the world class athletes Rose Lavelle and Mallory Pugh, who play right here in Germantown for the Washington Spirit. We are rooting for you! #USWNT https://www.nbcsports.com/washington/soccer/washington-spirits-rose-lavelle-and-mallory-pugh-ballers-score-three-goals-uswnt-world-cup …
Behind the scenes w/ @mattlpost and Alexa Chronister. Even when talking about serious issues, it’s important to take time to laugh. pic.twitter.com/GIVeMTq6Bl

The @CDC has not conducted research on gun violence in more than 20 years. We need to change that. Research on gun violence can help us solve the epidemic and save lives. #WeNeedToKnow @AMarch4OurLives @bradybuzz pic.twitter.com/yFypglhAtc

This is real leadership, @NIHDirector. 

I'm happy to pledge that I will no longer participate in any "manels." Diversity makes us stronger and we all must play our part in supporting inclusive practices that benefit us all. https://www.washingtonpost.com/health/nih-director-will-no-longer-speak-on-all-male-science-panels/2019/06/12/fe3b6386-8d2c-11e9-adf3-f70f78c156e8_story.html?utm_term=.6d2956237be9 …

The disturbing historical undertones are laid out pretty plainly here. This year we're on track to separate the highest number of immigrant children away from their families, and now the Trump Administration will hold them at a literal internment camp. http://time.com/5605120/trump-migrant-children-fort-sill/?xid=tcoshare#d43c48d8-c745-4336-89a0-1b6801acf06c?utm_source=twitter.com&utm_medium=social&utm_campaign=social-share-article …

This week was the first time EVER the pride flag was raised at the Montgomery County Executive Office Building. I'm proud to have leaders in our county that advocate for equality and inclusion and continue to fight for the rights of the LGBTQ community. #PrideMonth pic.twitter.com/kGJ22fnGvc

Today we remember the 49 victims of the Pulse Nightclub shooting in Orlando, FL that were murdered 3 years ago.

Hate and bigotry have no place in our communities. We must continue to support LGBTQ Americans and work to ensure equality for all. #WeAreOrlando pic.twitter.com/mOSOopMV53

Thank you Councilmember @willjawando for bringing attention to this outrageous event. Racial profiling is a daily reality for people of color and it is a vestige of Jim Crow. It's incomprehensible and epitomizes the disfunction in our criminal justice system. We must fix this. https://twitter.com/willjawando/status/1138057378799214592 …

What a great interview with my good friend @LilyQiMaryland. Her journey from China to the U.S. and subsequent election to the Maryland House of Delegates last year is a testament to her exceptional work ethic and the American Dream. Maryland is lucky to have her. https://twitter.com/LilyQiMaryland/status/1138068384510283776 …
That's why this year the House passed H.R. 7, the #PaycheckFairnessAct which strengthens the #EqualPay Act. We must continue to work until equal pay for equal work becomes a reality.
Today in 1963 the Equal Pay Act was signed into law. But now women still only make 80 cents for every dollar earned by a man - and the gap is even worse for women of color.

Farmers in Western Maryland deserve our attention and partnership at the local, state, and federal levels.

Thank you to Sec. Bartenfelder and @MdAgDept for joining us today to talk about the needs and priorities of farmers in Western Maryland! https://twitter.com/MdAgDept/status/1136999709086834688 …

Today marks the 75th anniversary of the invasion of Normandy by Allied forces. We will forever be indebted to the brave individuals who fought to protect democracy at home and abroad. Learn more about their story at  https://www.loc.gov/vets/  #DDay75 pic.twitter.com/fZvOGFSpjh
Today I'm proudly wearing #RedforFeds to show my support for VA workers in Maryland and across the country and their right to collectively bargain. @AFGENational pic.twitter.com/VONfcBpQd6

Affordable housing is the foundation for families and individuals across America and a vital part of our infrastructure. 

Today I'm learning about how to increase housing affordability with the House @NewDemCoalition Housing Task Force. pic.twitter.com/LkyJQ6ch3I
When women have reproductive freedom, their families and their communities are better off. We need #MenForChoice to stand up in support now more than ever. #StopTheBans

From the mountain ranges in Western Maryland to banks of the Potomac River, Maryland's 6th district is home to countless natural wonders. On #WorldEnvironmentDay, we are reminded that we must continue to protect and conserve our natural resources.

I stand with my 61 other freshmen colleagues to call on @senatemajldr to bring #HR1, the #ForThePeople Act, to the Senate floor. 

I came to Washington to represent real people, not PACs or lobbyists. #HR1 returns the power to the people. pic.twitter.com/MObDfnJHzd

I’m happy to stand behind Dreamers and support #HR6, the Dream and Promise Act. We must give these Dreamers a path to citizenship — it’s simply the right thing to do. 

#ProtectTheDream pic.twitter.com/Mqf48nyiqs

I was honored to hear @SpeakerPelosi testify in today’s hearing marking 30 years since the Tiananmen Square uprising and massacre. The Speaker has been a leader in fighting for human rights & democratic expression in China and reminded us that repression is still a reality today.

Today I’m hosting Michael as a part of #FosterYouthShadowDay. I got to hear about his experiences, and we even snagged a picture in the Chairman’s chair! 

Thank you @RepKarenBass for hosting this shadow day for #FosterYouthVoices. Every child deserves a loving home. pic.twitter.com/KQ30kBnGhg
Wishing Marylanders and those gathering around the world to celebrate the end of Ramadan a happy #EidMubarak!

.@JanGardnerExec is doing a great job with her leadership in Frederick, where I joined her today for a tour of the future detox center.

Opioids are killing our family and neighbors every day. We need more facilities like this detox center to help those suffering from addiction. https://twitter.com/JanGardnerExec/status/1135591169612664833 …

Another 12 lives lost in #VirginiaBeach.  While we mourn with the families and friends of those no longer with us, we must also demand action to put an end to gun violence in this country. Everyone should be on board to stop these awful tragedies.
